attributes.casual2: UnknownThe '''Battle of Seagard''' was a battle of the Greyjoy Rebellion, taking place approximately nine years before the beginning of the ''Game of Thrones'' series. The forces of House Greyjoy, led by Rodrik Greyjoy, the firstborn son and heir of Balon Greyjoy, attacked Seagard, seat of House Mallister, on Ironman's Bay. The attack, however, was a failure and Rodrik Greyjoy was killed by Jason Mallister, the Lord of Seagard.<ref>http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/guide/appendix/greyjoy-rebellion/ HBO Viewers Guide entry on the Greyjoy Rebellion</ref>==In the books==ďťżIn the ''A Song of Ice and Fire'' novels, Lord Jason Mallister slew Rodrik beneath the walls of Seagard and drove his men back into the sea. It was the only time in three hundred years that the bell in the Booming Tower of Seagard was rung.==See also==* AWOIAF==References==ReflistGreyjoyRebellionCategory:HistoryCategory:Battles

The '''Battle of Seagard''' was a battle of the [[Greyjoy Rebellion]], taking place approximately nine years before the beginning of the ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' series. The forces of [[House Greyjoy]], led by [[Rodrik Greyjoy]], the firstborn son and heir of [[Balon Greyjoy]], attacked [[Seagard]], seat of [[House Mallister]], on [[Ironman's Bay]]. The attack, however, was a failure and Rodrik Greyjoy was killed by [[Jason Mallister]], the Lord of Seagard.<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/guide/appendix/greyjoy-rebellion/ HBO Viewers Guide entry on the Greyjoy Rebellion]</ref>
sections.In the books: ďťżIn the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Lord Jason Mallister slew Rodrik beneath the walls of Seagard and drove his men back into the sea. It was the only time in three hundred years that the bell in the Booming Tower of Seagard was rung.
